title: Catalyst Crypto Venture Capital
description: Traditional business people don't understand how crypto can fund their businesses & how our industry improves the business landscape

f6_assessments.q0:
This is a proposal to build a generic marketing machine to reach proposers outside the crypto world. Pleas produce a specific proposal and explain how and why it would work.

Whilst this may be interesting, catalyst in not really here to fund standard businesses unless they are doing something that impact Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: As with the other 9 projects submitted by the same proposer, this seems to be a relatively generic exposition of a problem, and a general plan to then build a solution with out clear deliverables and an explanation of how this solution compares with other options or how it really is key to the challenge.
f6_assessments.q2: Whilst there is a road map, the deliverables aren't very specific. Build a list, outreach, use the list to get more people to the town hall, expand the list repeat. here should be some goals and metrics tracking the impact the provision of the services developed here have and how it adds to the success of the challenge

f6_assessments.q0:
You have (too) many proposals and none of them seem to provide an actual solution to the set challenge. Another issue is that as a visionary you think so many steps ahead that it's hard to see who is going to implement the very first steps.

This role, being a bridge or liaison between the new and the old world, is something that you as a seasoned entrepreneur would be really good at.
f6_assessments.q1: Why not scale it down considerably, ask for $3,000 and commit to introducing Cardano to three business networks of "traditional investors and entrepreneurs"? Then scale it up and handle matchmaking between proposers and the contacts from those business network. Finally, create a process around it. Get someone to shadow you and to run with the results so you can move on to the next project.
f6_assessments.q2:
Please build a proposal with small enough scope so that you can provide a more specific plan.

It's not enough to say that the target is to reach 1,000+  trade groups & organisations and 2,000+ gatekeepers & professional advisors. If you have this big goals, you should be able to outline who are the people doing the legwork, what kind of CRM are they using to keep up with all the connections... Details please.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal should be probably in another category, as it's not related to encouraging entrepreneurs from outside the Cardano ecosystem to submit proposals to Catalyst in the next two fund. Proposer just wants to build his own brand using the Catalyst funds.
f6_assessments.q1: Certainly the proposer has experience, but it won't help to encourage entrepreneurship in the Catalyst community. Moreover the budget is high. That's a lot for giving out to one person to build his brand
f6_assessments.q2: While the proposal itself has a lot of text and a long roadmap, the key metrics and KPIs are missing. It's also not clear how it will benefit Cardano entrepreneurs

f6_assessments.q0:
Has the problem needing to be solved been identified and articulated?
 Yes




Does this proposal fall within the scope of the challenge brief?
Yes



Does this proposal show clearly how it will add value to the Cardano System?
It is not clear 

 

Have key metrics and goals of the proposal been stated clearly 

They have been stated but to me dont seem very realistic due to the sheer number of organizations that have to be spoken to and relationships built with per day. They have estimated finding , initiating contact and building relationships with 10 new organizations per day.  




Do the key metrics and goals of the proposal fall within the scope of the challenge
Yes


Can the proposal scale to address future challenges?
The proposal needs to be carefully thought of and details found out in order to scale up. Right now its at a very conceptual stage.
f6_assessments.q1:
Has the proposer provided evidence (references, links, etc.) of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal?
Links are provided to a Cardano native token. What role this plays in the proposal I dont understand.
He also has provided his website and linked in profile.
 
Are these links sufficient?
It is hard to say. The Linkedin Profile shows a business conglomerate which describes itself as an Online supermarket which launches new ready made businesses, relaunches existing businesses and rescues businesses. 
 
Have you the CA visited these links and contacted the relevant people?
Yes I have visited the links but I cannot see a connection between the proposal requirements and the Linkedin profile and website. If there are all these online businesses which have been sold by CHG I want to find them listed on the site or linkedin profile. I have visited the discord server, telegram server, and ideascale site, and reddit page.

None of these online businesses are listed anywhere. I have looked on the corporate website as well. Still no links to any of the businesses. Its just a front end page.
 


Have you been able to assess their level of competence?
I have gone to each of the listed websites. I cannot indicate that they have shown competence in these areas.  If they have accomplished these, its not revealed by a regular search. 


Does proposer know, in an identifiable manner, the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal?
Not mentioned 

Has he rationally and logically laid out his team structure and breakdown?
Nothing mentioned 



Has budget been outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items?
Budget is laid out in rounded generalized numbers. No breakdown of what those budgets of 5000$ for each of the categories entail.

 

IS budget reasonable to achieve the set goals?
It is not possible to say since goals are too broad and metrics are not listed.  

Has the proposer provided a verifiable plan if additional funding is required to implement the proposal?
 No plan for additional funding

Have you verified this plan?
No 


Does proposal offer a realistic timetable to complete the work?
No 


Does the proposal provide a sensible and conductible plan for implementation that shows not only what is being done but also how?
There is a plan but not possible to say if its sensible or conductible. Its slick and shiny on the surface but i cannot go deeper than this.


Does the plan describe the resources necessary to implement the proposal?
No
 

Does the proposal clearly explain  technical aspects like architecture, language and technologies if they are crucial for implementation?
No 

Has the proposer considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation?
No
f6_assessments.q2:
Is there clearly laid out a roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement.
There is a road map with milestones but in my opinion it is impossible to accomplish 1000 new organizations contacted and relationships built in a 3 month period month, and also in that same period contacting 2000 gatekeepers.. and over a 12 month period approaching 20,000 trade groups and organizations and 100,000 gatekeepers and professional advisors.  This with a budget of 25,000 usd per year.



 

Are there clearly defined Metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal?
No.  The numbers of projected trade groups, organizations and gatekeepers approached is mentioned as a metric. Beyond that there are no metrics.



 

Is there a clear understandable description of the targeted problem?
Yes


 

Is there a clear understandable solution that addresses the problem?
Solution is clear. Whether this plan will achieve that is very unclear.



Has the proposer identified possible hurdles, challenges and difficulties?
No

 

How does the proposer plan to deal with these difficulties?
Not mentioned



 

Are there contingency plans in place for various outcomes?
No

f6_assessments.q0: An interesting proposal on the face of it, aiming to remove the knowledge barriers between business entrepreneurs and the understanding of Cardano. The proposer states a wealth of knowledge, which on the face of it looks interesting, however with further investigation many of the marketing channels stated are very much in their infancy and more context could be put into the proposal as to the relevance of these and how their business has the expertise to create this. I think the proposer should make it clearer if they are aiming to solely create a 12 month outreach programme or aim to build an ongoing community and how they would maintain that.
f6_assessments.q1:
Positively, there is a roadmap which states how the proposer plans to deliver their outreach programme to various audiences. Using my 15 years of experience in delivering marketing projects, there are some concerns which the proposer may want to address. Their roadmap indicates they plan to build a multi-lingual admin and marketing team but it is not clear how long the budget would pay for this - would they be looking at recruiting interim support to deliver the project or require ongoing support through the lifecycle? The 12-month roadmap of 20,000+ directory entries and 100,000+ advisors would allude to the need for some form of continuous admin support. It would be good to understand how, once established, how the proposer would maintain and add value to the many people signed up.

Additionally, the scope of the project needs to be clearer - there is mention of various audiences and countries, but I believe it would be better to create a proof of concept in one or two locations focused on a specific audience. If they deliver positive results at a smaller scale, then the project has a good opportunity to scale quite quickly to other geographies and audiences.
f6_assessments.q2: There are specific criteria which the proposer is aiming to hit over a defined timescale, which means it should be simple to review success criteria. My previous concerns on how they would launch this in multiple countries/multiple languages and across a number of audiences makes me question whether the budget requested will provide enough resource to hit the numbers in the proposal. There is a lack of risk assessment within the proposal - I think that a risk register would benefit the proposal. I would suggest that a proof of concept would be a positive way to showcase their skills and ability to deliver at a smaller scale to better understand realistic resource requirements and timescales at which they will get engaged participants.

f6_assessments.q0: The concept of Crypto venture capital does not really fit into Cardanos decentralized mission as it leads to centralisation and neither into the mission of Blockchain system above the purely monetary purpose.
f6_assessments.q1: While the plan is set up in a mostly detailed and correct manner, for several reasons, after some research the company does not seem up to the task. 1) The website and the social media does not match up to the self-acclaimed reputation and claimed size of the company (all media and social media coverage is selfmade, the wensite looks very unprofessional for someone who supposedly has been in the business for 23 years and the website discloses nothing about any staff member while there are apparently about 10 CH companies). Furthermore, taking a look into the UK business registry the company or versions of it was dissolved and re-found several times. The sheer amount of proposals from the proposer make it unlikely that he will be up to the task of finishing all of these. 2) Strike off requests from the company have been suspended or denied, which often means outstanding debt.
f6_assessments.q2: While milestones are set, some of the targets are defined very open. Furthermore, the fact that the company was already dissolved several times in the recent year make ot unlikely that the proposal can be audited. How can you audit a proposer who regularily dissolves his business?
f6_assessments.reply:
Dear vCA,
Only a personal opinion given: The assessor has decided they know the capabilities of the proposer based on a quick scan of social media and a misunderstanding about the status of the company, they have made a blanket judgement of all ten proposals based on incorrect judgements. There is no debt because the company has never traded, all assessments are copied and pasted on each of my proposals showing a general bias against all of my proposals.
Unconstructive assessment: The UK Companies are all in good order, this assessor does not understand UK company law, the companies have not been dissolved even once, Notices were served to dissolve the company one time, when I thought about discontinuing the project but I decided to continue and filed the necessary document to continue the company. This does not indicate a lack of ability to complete the proposal.
Regards,
Carl Henry

f6_assessments.q0:
If I understood the proposal correctly, the idea is to create a bridge - webpage? focused mainly on translations and possibly to form teams, and bring more people to cardano. 

three stars, because proposer outreach is just a side effect of the outcome.
f6_assessments.q1:
links provided
webpage visited - tbh, I find it too messy and unclear, too many pictures, low organizational structure. If the result would be according to the example, then I do not think it would be "successful" as planned.
f6_assessments.q2:
information for audit:

to some extent, the information provided can be audited, yet it is more vague than specific

information of the success:

number of interactions
views
members
interactions

yet it would be hard to determine how many new proposers resulted from this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
It's always a challege to know the real intentions of a person, an institution, or a group.  However, this proposal is maybe the most clear and honest proposal that I have the opportunity of evaluate. The proposer has its own shop and, as is natural, its work is found new lines of business.  The proposer has done the homework:   from subsidiaries in housing, finance, property, internet, corporate, lifestyle  and other areas (that make up the Carl Henry Group)  to having its own token ("CHG").    

According to the information provided for the proposal,  In general, it's a man with experience.  An the experience, as all reasonable person knows, is invaluable.  But, I don't think that the proposer, as a one-man band (there is no trace of a team behind its work)  understands really the spirit of the ecosystem.  There is no about the money.
f6_assessments.q1:
-	Aparently, there is no a team behind the proposal.  It's a one-man act.  It's only a business man and not a fool, clumsy, scruffy and hunger hadful of girls and guys that do not fit in any place.  Unquestionably, the experience of a thousand battles is rock solid but the ingenuity is a good sign.  

-  The proposer provides a budget but not a budget clearly outline and broken down into identifiable items.

-	The proposer does not provide a sensible and conductible plan for implementation that shows not only what is being done but also how.

-	The plan does not describe the resources necessary to implement the proposal. 

-	The proposal does not clearly explain technical aspects like architecture, languages or tecnologies crucial for implementation.

-	The proposer has not considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: -	The proposal does not present clear metrics/KPIs  that define the success of the proposal or some means of monitoring the proposal.  The community will not be able to audit the progress of the proposal.

solution: Multilingual multimedia outreach to business & trade organisations & members with content created by real world experienced business people
experience: 43 yrs experience in multiple businesses including finance, real estate, internet, corporate & lifestyle industries internationally
